verses.verse: And Jehovah <WH3068> visited <WH6485> Sarah <WH8283> as he had said <WH559>, and Jehovah <WH3068> did <WH6213> unto Sarah <WH8283> as he had spoken <WH1696>.
And Sarah <WH8283> conceived <WH2029>, and bare <WH3205> Abraham <WH85> a son <WH1121> in his old age <WH2208>, at the set time <WH4150> of which God <WH430> had spoken to him <WH1696>.
And Abraham <WH85> called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of his son <WH1121> that was born <WH3205> unto him <WH8283>, whom Sarah bare <WH3205> to him <WH3327>, Isaac.
And Abraham <WH85> circumcised <WH4135> his son <WH1121> Isaac <WH3327> when he was eight <WH8083> days <WH3117> old <WH1121>, as God <WH430> had commanded him <WH6680>.
And Abraham <WH85> was a hundred <WH3967> years <WH8141> old <WH1121>, when his son <WH1121> Isaac <WH3327> was born unto him <WH3205>.
And Sarah <WH8283> said <WH559>, God <WH430> hath made <WH6213> me to laugh <WH6712>; every one that heareth <WH8085> will laugh with me <WH6711>.

And she said <WH559>, Who would have said <WH4448> unto Abraham <WH85>, that Sarah <WH8283> should give children <WH1121> suck <WH3243>? for I have borne <WH3205> him a son <WH1121> in his old age <WH2208>.
And the child <WH3206> grew <WH1431>, and was weaned <WH1580>: and Abraham <WH85> made <WH6213> a great <WH1419> feast <WH4960> on the day <WH3117> that Isaac <WH3327> was weaned <WH1580>.
And Sarah <WH8283> saw <WH7200> the son <WH1121> of Hagar <WH1904> the Egyptian <WH4713>, whom she had borne <WH3205> unto Abraham <WH85>, mocking <WH6711>.

Wherefore she said <WH559> unto Abraham <WH85>, Cast out <WH1644> this handmaid <WH519> and her son <WH1121>: for the son <WH1121> of this handmaid <WH519> shall not be heir <WH3423> with my son <WH1121>, even with Isaac <WH3327>.
And the thing <WH1697> was very <WH3966> grievous <WH3415> in Abraham <WH85>'s sight <WH5869> on account <WH182> of his son <WH1121>.

And God <WH430> said <WH559> unto Abraham <WH85>, Let it not be grievous <WH3415> in thy sight <WH5869> because of the lad <WH5288>, and because of thy handmaid <WH519>; in all that Sarah <WH8283> saith <WH559> unto thee <WH8085>, hearken unto her voice <WH6963>; for in Isaac <WH3327> shall thy seed <WH2233> be called <WH7121>.
And also of the son <WH1121> of the handmaid <WH519> will I make <WH7760> a nation <WH1471>, because he is thy seed <WH2233>.

And Abraham <WH85> rose up early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, and took <WH3947> bread <WH3899> and a bottle <WH2573> of water <WH4325>, and gave <WH5414> it unto Hagar <WH1904>, putting <WH7760> it on her shoulder <WH7926>, and gave her the child <WH3206>, and sent her away <WH7971>: and she departed <WH3212>, and wandered <WH8582> in the wilderness <WH4057> of Beer-sheba <WH884>.
And the water <WH4325> in <WH4480> the bottle <WH2573> was spent <WH3615>, and she cast <WH7993> the child <WH3206> under one <WH259> of the shrubs <WH7880>.

And she went <WH3212>, and sat her down <WH3427> over against <WH5048> him a good way off <WH7368>, as it were a bowshot <WH2909>: for she said <WH559>, Let me not look <WH7200> upon the death <WH4194> of the child <WH3206>. And she sat <WH3427> over against him <WH5375>, and lifted up her voice <WH6963>, and wept <WH1058>.

And God <WH430> heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of the lad <WH5288>; and the angel <WH4397> of God <WH430> called <WH7121> to Hagar <WH1904> out of heaven <WH8064>, and said <WH559> unto her <WH1904>, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear <WH3372> not <WH430>; for God hath heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of the lad where he is <WH5288>.
Arise <WH6965>, lift up <WH5375> the lad <WH5288>, and hold <WH2388> him in thy hand <WH3027>; for I will make <WH7760> him a great <WH1419> nation <WH1471>.

And God <WH430> opened <WH6491> her eyes <WH5869>, and she saw <WH7200> a well <WH875> of water <WH4325>; and she went <WH3212>, and filled <WH4390> the bottle <WH2573> with water <WH4325>, and gave <WH8248> the lad <WH5288> drink <WH8248>.
And God <WH430> was with the lad <WH5288>, and he grew <WH1431>; and he dwelt <WH3427> in the wilderness <WH4057>, and became <WH7235>, as he grew up, an archer.
And he dwelt <WH3427> in the wilderness <WH4057> of Paran <WH6290>: and his mother <WH517> took <WH3947> him a wife <WH802> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

And it came to pass at that time <WH6256>, that Abimelech <WH40> and Phicol <WH6369> the captain <WH8269> of his host <WH6635> spake <WH559> unto Abraham <WH85>, saying <WH559>, God <WH430> is with thee in all that thou doest <WH6213>:

now therefore swear <WH7650> unto me here <WH2008> by God <WH430> that thou wilt not deal falsely <WH8266> with me <WH5209>, nor with my son, nor with my son <WH5220>'s son: but according to the kindness <WH2617> that I have done <WH6213> unto thee <WH6213>, thou shalt do unto me <WH776>, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned <WH1481>.
And Abraham <WH85> said <WH559>, I will swear <WH7650>.
And Abraham <WH85> reproved <WH3198> Abimelech <WH40> because <WH182> of the well <WH875> of water <WH4325>, which Abimelech <WH40>'s servants <WH5650> had violently taken away <WH1497>.

And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559>, I know <WH3045> not who hath done <WH6213> this thing <WH1697>: neither <WH3808> didst thou tell <WH5046> me <WH3808>, neither yet heard <WH8085> I of it <WH1115>, but to-day <WH3117>.
And Abraham <WH85> took <WH3947> sheep <WH6629> and oxen <WH1241>, and gave <WH5414> them <WH8147> unto Abimelech <WH40>; and they two made <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285>.
And Abraham <WH85> set <WH5324> seven <WH7651> ewe lambs <WH3535> of the flock by themselves <WH6629>.
And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559> unto Abraham <WH85>, What <WH2008> mean these seven <WH7651> ewe lambs <WH3535> which thou hast set by themselves <WH5324>?

And he said <WH559>, These seven <WH7651> ewe lambs <WH3535> shalt thou take <WH3947> of my hand <WH3027>, that <WH5668> it may be a witness <WH5713> unto me <WH2658>, that I have digged this well <WH875>.
Wherefore he called <WH7121> that place <WH4725> Beer-sheba <WH884>; because there they sware <WH7650> both of them <WH8147>.

So they made <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> at Beer-sheba <WH884>: and Abimelech <WH40> rose up <WH6965>, and Phicol <WH6369> the captain <WH8269> of his host <WH6635>, and they returned <WH7725> into the land <WH776> of the Philistines <WH6430>.
And Abraham planted <WH5193> a tamarisk <WH815> tree in Beer-sheba <WH884>, and called <WH7121> there on the name <WH8034> of Jehovah <WH3068>, the Everlasting <WH5769> God <WH410>.
And Abraham <WH85> sojourned <WH1481> in the land <WH776> of the Philistines <WH6430> many <WH7227> days <WH3117>.
